page.title: 13LOWER MODDERSHALL & MILLS 1
page.content: Lower Moddershall is composed of a valley following the stream and ponds once used for a series of working mills, the top pond being at the Boars Head, from where the stream runs downhill through the one remaining mill pond, and on to the side of the Longton Road to Stone. The remaining pond is situated in the grounds of Splashy Mill, and the wheel remaining intact, is in working order, and a B listed building. As far as one knows it has never lapsed into inactivity, and the wheel itself has recently had new wooden slats and works well. The whole area of Lower Moddershall is a conservation area, and except for a cluster of 5 houses is mainly grass and woodland. The trees are mostly deciduous, the most attractive being a group of larches by Splashy Mill pond.
